trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGNOR4AMITY_00593_JUDINE_000_000<tab>Greetings, traveler. I realize Amity is not the most well-known settlement, so feel free to ask any questions you might have.

TEXT_REGNOR4AMITY_00593_JUDINE_000_010<tab>Oh, whatever's needed. Back in Eulmore, however, I used to work as a chef...right up until I made a dish which some free citizen deemed “bland and uninspired.”
TEXT_REGNOR4AMITY_00593_JUDINE_000_011<tab>The next thing I knew I was dumped outside with the scraps and left to rot. But I survived. And rumors of other survivors led me here to Amity.

TEXT_REGNOR4AMITY_00593_JUDINE_000_012<tab>I may have slipped from the lap of luxury, but naught compares to the freedom I feel now. No executioner's blade hanging over me every time I prepare a meal...
TEXT_REGNOR4AMITY_00593_JUDINE_000_020<tab>Those who know their history say this was once a thriving center for trade between Eulmore and the dwarves. But that was over a hundred years ago.
TEXT_REGNOR4AMITY_00593_JUDINE_000_021<tab>Whatever ties survived the Flood were later severed completely when Lord Vauthry came into power, and Amity was abandoned by both sides.

TEXT_REGNOR4AMITY_00593_JUDINE_000_022<tab>I'd be surprised if more than a handful of people below the Ladder even know this town exists anymore. Which, you have to admit, was the perfect situation for a collection of exiles and fugitives just looking to be left alone.
